meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: PSY Apologizes For Anti-American Military Lyrics

div.div: This morning, the news broke that Korean mega-star “Gangnam Style” singer PSY had participated in several anti-American rallies during the Iraq War. Now, he's issued an apology.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VCQUtp&via=Digg&text=PSY Apologizes For Anti-American Military Lyrics

div.a: DNA Helps Free An Inmate On Death Row For 15 Years

div.div: Damon Thibodeaux has been proved innocent of a crime for which Louisiana has spent 15 years trying to kill him.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11NuKoP&via=Digg&text=DNA Helps Free An Inmate On Death Row For 15 Years

div.a: U.S. Attorney Jim Letten Resigns After Scandal Over Online Comments

div.div: For more than a decade, U.S. attorney Jim Letten has taken down some Louisiana's most corrupt politicians, crooked cops, and notorious scam artists. Now the storied public servant has fallen from grace following a string of comments made by Letten’s own prosecutors on nola.com, the website for "The Times-Picayune."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TJHObU&via=Digg&text=U.S. Attorney Jim Letten Resigns After Scandal Over Online Comments

div.div: NO MORE TEACHERS, NO MORE BOOKS

div.a: Google, Wikipedia Are Kids' Top Tools For School Research

div.div: Are you old enough to remember when doing research meant opening up incredibly boring encyclopedias or, even worse, flipping through your library’s card catalogue? Well, American kids these days don’t have to put up with such indignities as they’re turning to more modern tools to help them write research papers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SRnhQy&via=Digg&text=Google, Wikipedia Are Kids' Top Tools For School Research

div.a: TEDx: Some Ideas Are Not Worth Spreading

div.div: TED takes on pseudoscience and bad information.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QNubbl&via=Digg&text=TEDx: Some Ideas Are Not Worth Spreading

div.a: The Time A German Teenager Landed A Plane In Front Of The Kremlin

div.div: In 1987 a West German teenager shocked the world, by flying through Soviet air defenses to land a Cessna in Red Square. He was jailed for more than a year - but a quarter of a century later, he has no regrets.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VAjITl&via=Digg&text=The Time A German Teenager Landed A Plane In Front Of The Kremlin

div.a: The Secrets Of The Internet's Most Beloved Viral Marketer

div.div: Matthew Inman's site, The Oatmeal, is one of the biggest comics on the web. Why the “envy of nearly every cartoonist” is suddenly under siege.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VClRhd&via=Digg&text=The Secrets Of The Internet's Most Beloved Viral Marketer

div.a: Google Stops Offering Google Apps For Free

div.div: Google has announced a significant decision that will stop users from signing up to its Google Apps service free of charge.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VMblAi&via=Digg&text=Google Stops Offering Google Apps For Free

div.a: What Obama Looked Like When He Received Mitt Romney's Concession Call

div.div: The White House just released a picture by Pete Souza that shows President Obama taking a concession call from Gov. Mitt Romney on election day.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xz7xq9&via=Digg&text=What Obama Looked Like When He Received Mitt Romney's Concession Call

div.a: So This Is What A Real Life Hoverboard Looks Like

div.div: The official Mattel Back to the Future hoverboard is here and it looks exactly like it did in "Back to the Future II": happy neon pink retro future glory.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YT0Gbn&via=Digg&text=So This Is What A Real Life Hoverboard Looks Like

div.div: AT LEAST THEY'VE GOT THE FITNESS BALL

div.a: 'Redneck Aerobics' Looks Really Stupid And Dangerous

div.div: It’s like the backwoods version of "Jackass."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RHJRy5&via=Digg&text='Redneck Aerobics' Looks Really Stupid And Dangerous

div.a: To Catch A Suspect — On Pinterest

div.div: Pinterest is known as a place where people share recipes, crafts or fashion. But a new set of images have started showing up on the social media site: mug shots.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QMiIsA&via=Digg&text=To Catch A Suspect — On Pinterest

div.a: U.S. Supreme Court Will Hear Same-Sex Marriage Arguments

div.div: The U.S. Supreme Court agreed Friday to take its first serious look at the issue of gay marriage, granting review of California's ban on same-sex marriage and of a federal law that defines marriage as only the legal union of a man and a woman.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SE16gJ&via=Digg&text=U.S. Supreme Court Will Hear Same-Sex Marriage Arguments

div.a: Next Media Animation Immortalizes The John McAfee Saga In Amazing Video

div.div: It was only a matter of time before the endless John McAfee saga became forever immortalized in the Internet’s consciousness by Next Media Animation, the Taiwanese studio that serves as a barometer for all things pop culture. And boy did they do Mr. McAfee’s bizarre, erratic behavior justice.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VoarIb&via=Digg&text=Next Media Animation Immortalizes The John McAfee Saga In Amazing Video

div.a: Gollum Actor: How New Motion-Capture Tech Improved 'The Hobbit'

div.div: Motion-capture technology has come a long way since the first Lord of the Rings film in 2001, bridging some of the “disconnect” the Gollum actor felt while filming on separate live-action and motion-capture stages for the original trilogy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RHWRDS&via=Digg&text=Gollum Actor: How New Motion-Capture Tech Improved 'The Hobbit'

div.a: 'Homicide Victims Rarely Talk To Police,' And Other Horrible Headlines

div.div: Here’s a collection of newspaper headlines that don’t quite accomplish what the writer set out to accomplish. Anyone who has ever written or published anything can surely sympathize — and laugh.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TJNMGO&via=Digg&text='Homicide Victims Rarely Talk To Police,' And Other Horrible Headlines

div.div: AT LEAST THEY AGREE ON SPRINGSTEEN

div.a: Chris Christie, Jon Stewart Spar Over Republican Philosophy

div.div: Governor Chris Christie sat down with Jon Stewart on Thursday night's "Daily Show" for what ended up being a long, occasionally tense discussion of ongoing Sandy relief efforts and the Republican philosophy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SDdMVk&via=Digg&text=Chris Christie, Jon Stewart Spar Over Republican Philosophy

div.a: Conan O'Brien Predicts The Comedic Apocalypse

div.div: Conan O'Brien pontificates on how humor will take over—and soon destroy—America.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YvfWMF&via=Digg&text=Conan O'Brien Predicts The Comedic Apocalypse

div.a: Colors According To A Blind Person

div.div: Tommy Edison, who has never seen color in his life, talks about his unique perspective in this short video.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/THjOmi&via=Digg&text=Colors According To A Blind Person

div.div: The team at Unimark wore lab coats, and at one point they drafted a manifesto declaring their allegiance to sans-serif type. When Noorda and his partner Massimo Vignelli took on the subway signs, they didn’t just update them — they invented what they thought of as a new grammar for New York City.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RHEyPn&via=Digg&text=Who Made The Subway Signage?

div.a: This Chocolate Might Work Like Viagra

div.div: Brace yourself. Chocolate euphemisms are coming. And in the interest of staying family-friendly, I officially declare this article pun-free. Anything suggestive you pick up is your own fault. Shame on you.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UiP6ij&via=Digg&text=This Chocolate Might Work Like Viagra

div.div: IT'S COMING FROM INSIDE YOUR HEAD

div.a: How Sound Works On Google's Project Glass

div.div: Several users who have been lucky enough to try out Project Glass have noted that the headset produces sound. Rather than use a headphone jack, sounds come from a speaker somewhere on the device.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YJmcRf&via=Digg&text=How Sound Works On Google's Project Glass

div.div: GOOD NEWS FOR ALEC BALDWIN AND FRIENDS

div.a: FCC Chairman Urges FAA To Allow Use Of Tablets During Takeoff And Landing

div.div: Federal Communications Commission (FCC) Chairman Julius Genachowski is now urging the Federal Aviaition Administration (FAA) to "enable greater use of tablets, e-readers, and other portable devices" during all phases of flight.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TG5Lh4&via=Digg&text=FCC Chairman Urges FAA To Allow Use Of Tablets During Takeoff And Landing

div.a: Cat Parasite Uses 'Trojan Horse' To Infect Human Brain, May Cause Suicidal Thoughts, Risk-Taking

div.div: A food-borne parasite that infects domestic cats can get inside the human brain by commandeering special cells of the immune system which it uses as a Trojan horse to enter the central nervous system, a study has found.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VA92nB&via=Digg&text=Cat Parasite Uses 'Trojan Horse' To Infect Human Brain, May Cause Suicidal Thoughts, Risk-Taking
